title: Tanaka LiftLoc Front Basket Rack
content:
Japanese component manufacturer Tanaka has a new rack that incorporates clamps to hold a basket to it.

The LiftLoc Front Basket Rack uses a wide platform with adjustable mounting stays and small CNC-machined clamps to secure a wire basket. No zip-ties are required. The Tanaka rack can also be used for bag support.

Specs:

  • Aluminum construction
  • 20.5 x 19 cm platform
  • Adjustable stays similar to Nitto M1 Rack. These are 250 and 410mm long. So it can be used on mini rack mounts. pannier rack mounts or three pack mounts. The long stay is even long enough to reach a fender eyelet on the dropout of a road or gravel fork)
  • Trim to fit.
  • Can be used as a rear rack if you use P-clamps (not included) or have extra rack mounts as some Rivendell bikes do AND get a tang to install on your seatstay bridge.
  • Three-point mounting system for the basket (removable if you donâ€™t need it)
  • Auxiliary eyelet under rack for mounting accessories like a light
  • Black or Silver
